required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Residual Sample Collection for Respiratory Viral Panel
clinical_study.official_title: De-identified Residual Sample Collection for the Respiratory Viral Panel on the GenMark Sample to Answer Platform (ARM 1)

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: Collect de-identified, residual samples to support a clinical trial. Samples may be prospectively or retrospectively collected. Overall Study Objective Obtain clinical performance data to characterize clinical performance of the Respiratory Viral Panel on the GenMark Sample-to-Answer Platform.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this investigational study is to collect clinical samples to establish the clinical performance characteristics of the in vitro diagnostic (IVD) Respiratory Viral Panel on the GenMark Sample-to-Answer Platform. Data obtained from the samples will be used to support premarket submissions/registrations for this GenMark product. Samples will be aliquotted, characterized by comparator methods and banked until the instrument and assay are available for testing.
Sample collection may be prospective or retrospective. Prospective collection will preserve prevalence. Retrospective collection will be used to obtain sufficient numbers of certain sample types such as where the organism of interest is of low prevalence. The Sponsor will ensure that information identifying samples as prospectively or retrospectively collected is documented.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patient specimens that test positive by new test method vs. those that test positive by the gold standard method e.g., Culture
primary_outcome.time_frame: One year from collection and culture testing to testing by new test method.
primary_outcome.description: This is an IVD Diagnostic study.

clinical_study.condition: Respiratory Viral Illnesses: Influenza A/B, RSV, Adenovirus

study_pop.textblock: Children and adults of any age suspected of having respiratory infection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sample from patients exhibiting signs/symptoms of respiratory viral infection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Samples that are incorrectly de-identified
- Samples that are received from sites incorrectly frozen or thawed.
